sen.j: 矢来観世家（やらい-かんぜ-け）は能楽シテ方観世流の職分家のひとつ。
sen.e: The Yarai Kanze family is one of the occupational branch families of Kanze school of Nohgaku theatre shite-kata (main roles).
The Yarai Kanze family is one of the occupational branch families of Kanze school of Nohgaku theatre shite-kata (main roles).
The Yarai Kanze family is one of the occupational branch families of Kanze school of Nohgaku theatre shite-kata (main roles).
They superintend Kanze Kyukokai.
They preside over the Kanze Kyukokai.
They preside over the Kanze Kyukokai.

sen.j: 分家観世銕之丞家の分家筋にあたる。
sen.e: The family is a branch family of Tetsunojo KANZE's branch families.
The family is a branch family of Tetsunojo KANZE's branch families.
The family is a branch family of Tetsunojo KANZE's branch families.

sen.j: 梅若がかりの芸風を持ち、流内で宗家、分家、梅若両家に次ぐ格式と規模を持つ。
sen.e: They have the status and scale ranked after Soke (the head family or house), branch family and UMEWAKA family in the school.
They have the status and scale ranked after Soke (the head family or house), branch family and UMEWAKA family in the school.
They have the status and scale ranked after Soke (the head family or house), branch family and UMEWAKA family in the school.
Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 明治期に銕之丞家四世の観世清済の次男源次郎氏演が初世梅若実の婿養子となって五十三世梅若六郎を相続・襲名した。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, the second son of Kiyoyuki KANZE (the fourth Tetsunojo KANZE), Genjiro married a daughter of the first Minoru UMEWAKA and succeeded to the name of the 53rd Rokuro UMEWAKA.
sen.cmt: 「氏演」は入力ミスのようです。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, the second son of Kiyoyuki KANZE (the fourth Tetsunojo KANZE), Genjiro married a daughter of the first Minoru UMEWAKA and succeeded to the name of the 53rd Rokuro UMEWAKA.
In the Meiji period, the second son of Kiyoyuki KANZE (the fourth Tetsunojo KANZE), Genjiro married a daughter of the first Minoru UMEWAKA and succeeded to the name of the 53rd Rokuro UMEWAKA.

sen.j: 後に実に二人の実子（初世梅若万三郎・二世梅若実）が生れた。
sen.e: Then, Minoru had two biological children (Manaburo UMEWAKA, the first and Minoru UMEWAKA, the second).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Then, Minoru had two biological children (Manzaburo UMEWAKA, the first and Minoru UMEWAKA, the second).
Then, Minoru had two biological children (Manzaburo UMEWAKA, the first and Minoru UMEWAKA, the second).

sen.j: 源次郎が、観世姓に復して分家したことにはじまる。
sen.e: Genjiro returned to the Kanze family and started a new branch family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Genjiro returned to the Kanze family and started a new branch family.
Genjiro returned to the Kanze family and started a new branch family.

sen.j: 分家後、源次郎は観世清之を名乗り、牛込矢来町に舞台を設けて、九皐会としての活動を行うようになる
sen.e: After creating a branch family, Genjiro gave his name as Kiyoshi KANZE, prepared a stage in Ushigomeyarai-cho, and started the activity as Kyukokai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After creating a branch family, Genjiro gave his name as Kiyoshi KANZE, prepared a stage in Ushigomeyarai-cho, and started the activity as Kyukokai.
After creating a branch family, Genjiro gave his name as Kiyoshi KANZE, prepared a stage in Ushigomeyarai-cho, and started the activity as Kyukokai.

sen.j: （独立は1908年。月並会の開催は1911年より）。
sen.e: (The foundation was in 1908.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: (The foundation was in 1908.
(The foundation was in 1908. The monthly performance started in 1911.)
sen.cmt: 括弧内なので一つにまとめました。

sen.j: 以上のような事情のため、芸系は梅若派に属するが、梅若流独立騒動の際には宗家派に立って最後まで観世流にとどまった（一説には梅若家との感情の齟齬があったともいわれる）。
sen.e: Although their performance style belonged to the Umewaka school due to the above mentioned circumstances, they supported the Soke school and remained in the Kanze school to the last when Umewaka school separated (According to one theory, there was an emotional disagreement with Umewaka family).

Although their performance style belonged to the Umewaka school due to the above mentioned circumstances, they supported the Soke school and remained in the Kanze school to the last when Umewaka school separated (According to one theory, there was an emotional disagreement with Umewaka family).

Although their performance style belonged to the Umewaka school due to the above mentioned circumstances, they supported the Soke school and remained in the Kanze school to the last when Umewaka school separated (According to one theory, there was an emotional disagreement with Umewaka family).

sen.j: また1907年には丸岡莞爾の観世流改定本刊行会（現能楽書林）と協力し、それまでの謡本と一線を画す改訂本を独自に刊行。
sen.e: Moreover, in 1907, in cooperation with Kanji Maruoka's Publishing Association of the Kanze-School Revised Editions (the present Nohgakushorin), they published their own revised Utai-bon (chant book), which was clearly different from the previous books.

Moreover, in 1907, in cooperation with Kanji Maruoka's Publishing Association of the Kanze-School Revised Editions (the present Nohgakushorin), they published their own revised Utai-bon (chant book), which was clearly different from the previous books.

Moreover, in 1907, in cooperation with Kanji Maruoka's Publishing Association of the Kanze-School Revised Editions (the present Nohgakushorin), they published their own revised Utai-bon (chant book), which was clearly different from the previous books.

sen.j: 江戸期以来の慣行として、流儀の謡本は宗家のみに版権が帰属するとされていた。
sen.e: Since the Edo period, copyright of Utai-bon of the school has been customary considered to belong exclusively to the Soke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Since the Edo period, copyright of Utai-bon of the school was customary considered to belong exclusively to the Soke.
Since the Edo period, copyright of Utai-bon of the school was customarily considered to belong exclusively to the Soke.

sen.j: そのため当時の能楽界において問題化した。
sen.e: Therefore, it becomes an issue among Nohgaku theatre community at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, it became an issue among Nohgaku theater community at that time.
Therefore, it became an issue among Nohgaku theater community at that time.

sen.j: 宗家と清之の間で裁判が行われた。
sen.e: The Soke and Kiyoshi KANZE fought in court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Soke and Kiyoshi KANZE fought in court.
The Soke and Kiyoshi KANZE fought in court.

sen.j: 結果は大審院において清之側の勝訴が確定。
sen.e: Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) found in favor of Kiyoshi KANZE.
Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) found in favor of Kiyoshi KANZE.
Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) found in favor of Kiyoshi KANZE.

sen.j: 以来能楽書林とは深い関係にある。
sen.e: Since then, the family has had close relationship with Nohgakushorin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Since then, the family has had close relationship with Nohgakushorin.
Since then, the family has had close relationship with Nohgakushorin.

sen.j: 現在でも、同社から独自の謡本を発行して使用している。
sen.e: To this day, they still use original Utai-bon published by Nohgakushorin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: To this day, they still use original Utai-bon published by Nohgakushorin.
